Josiah was eight years old when he became the king
. He ruled from Jerusalem for 31 years.
He did things that were pleasing to Yahweh and conducted his life like his ancestor King David had done. He fully obeyed [IDM] all the laws of God.
When he had been ruling for almost eight years, while he was still a young man, he began to worship God like his ancestor
David had done. Four years later, he began to get rid of all the pagan shrines on hilltops in Jerusalem and in
Asherah, and the carved idols and statues of gods.
While he directed them, his workers tore down the altars where people worshiped Baal. They smashed the altars that were near those altars, where people burned incense. They smashed the poles to
Asherah and the idols and statues. They smashed them to bits and scattered the bits over the graves of those who had offered sacrifices to them.
They burned the bones of the priests
; they burned them on their own altars. In that way Josiah caused Jerusalem and other places in Judah to be acceptable places to worship Yahweh again.
